intro: Listera cordata f. crassa, commonly known as the broad-leaved spring beauty, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodland environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broader and more robust compared to the typical form of Listera cordata, giving it a distinct appearance. It is often found in the eastern United States, where it contributes to the biodiversity of forest ecosystems.
